meanings.definition: Idolisms: The beliefs, practices, or characteristics associated with the worship of idols.
meanings.sent1: In some ancient cultures, idolisms were central to their religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various idolisms used in ancient rituals.
meanings.sent3: The tour guide joked that the idolisms in the temple were like a language only the gods understood.
meanings.sent4: Her devotion to the idolisms of her ancestors was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The intricate idolisms carved into the stone walls told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: Idolisms: Phrases or expressions that are characteristic of a particular idol or idolatrous culture.
meanings.sent1: The pop star's fans often use idolisms to express their admiration.
meanings.sent2: The idolisms in their speech revealed their deep connection to the idol.
meanings.sent3: She found it amusing how the idolisms of the group had influenced her own language.
meanings.sent4: The idolisms of the celebrity spread like wildfire among the fans.
meanings.sent5: His use of idolisms in everyday conversation made him stand out in the crowd.
